TopicTitle: Gather... ALL the Science!!! (every science expirement possible)(Kerbin system 100% explored!!

Articles.Content:
Hey fellow kerbonauts!!

So I started a new career... and I thought; how many science is there to be gathered troughout the kerbol system?

so all the expirements in all the biomes on all the bodies.

not including:

  • - station science
  • - repeating science experiments
  • - asteroid science
  • - etc

I started a new science career and edited the savegame so I could unlock the whole techtree. 

mods I use are only for convenience:

  • Mechjeb
  • RPM
  • Vesselviewer
  • Final Frontier
  • Trajectories
  • Astronomers Visual Pack

Im planning to keep you guys up to date in the coming period on the findings of the Kerbol Exploration Program!!

Parts:

  1. First Steps at Kerbin
  2. Roving the KSC
  3. Vessel introduction
  4. Kerbin Explorations part 1
  5. Kerbin Explorations part 2
  6. Kerbin Explorations part 3
  7. Onwards to Mun!
  8. From Mun to Minmus with love
  9. KHASE
  10. KSR Mission
  11. Departure Party and Mohole (not) in one!

 

Progress:

Spoiler

Kerbol = 0%

Moho = 0%

Eve = 0%

Gilly = 0%

Kerbin = 100%

Mun = 100%

Minmus = 100%

Duna = 0%

Ike = 0%

Dres = 0%

Jool = 0%

Vall = 0%

Tylo = 0%

Laythe = 0%

Bop = 0%

Pol = 0%

Eeloo = 0%

 

Edit: Any suggestions for craft, explorations or other topics are welcome!

 

Kreetings!

Ferdoni

Edited May 31, 2017 by Ferdoni

~First Steps at Kerbin~

The first part!!!

I've launched a zillion spacecraft already but i wanted to show you the first steps on kerbin.

This is the Kerbin Biome Explorer:

This plane is made to fly to every biome and gather the science. 

It can also mine and refuel at any place and on board are science experiments and a lab to restore the materials bay and mystery goo:

 

Because I dont want to drive all the way around KSC with this thing, I made three other constraptions to gather science, plug it on the Plane and let the container gather all the science  This includes the biomes: Crawlerway, Runway, Launchpad, KSC, Shores, Water, Mountains and Highlands. This is because the plane is unfit to get there.






Biomes explored in this episode are:

-Kerbin-

  • KSC
  • Launchpad
  • Crawlerway
  • Runway
  • Water
  • Shores
  • Mountains
  • Highlands

only 8 more to go on kerbin!

  • Ice Caps
  • Northern Ice Shelf
  • Southern Ice Shelf
  • Tundra
  • Grasslands
  • Deserts
  • Badlands
  • Atmosphere

oh boy... that means quite a long fight from the north to the south...  

Stay tuned!!

Ferdoni

I will not give you a headache but on KSC there are much more

Funny Kabooms

~Roving the KSC~

Hello fellow kerbonauts!

Okay, so after a hopeful post that gave me a slight headache,
I made a small rover-like car to gather all the science from the
micro biomes at the KSC.

I used this map from reddit:

As you see I added a science lab to clean out the mystery goo and materials bay, if I had to do that by a scientist every time, I would went crazy pretty soon!
 

I had to use quite some 'acrobatic' manoeuvering
 

but got some nice biomes!
 

But at last!! i gathered 290 science expirements!!! that means 29 micro biomes ^^
 

Docked it at the Kerbin Biome Scanner
 


Turned out I scanned 2 biomes twice, runway and vab, so my science container now contains...

 

 

 

 

348 science expirements!!!!!!
Pretty succesful round while not moving more than 1km from the KSC ^^

 

Gathered 35 biomes, that means only 8 to go for real now, but that comes in some other episode.


Thats it for this part, in the next part I will show you wich spacecraft are already
airborne so stay tuned!!

greetz
Ferdoni

Edited April 12, 2017 by Ferdoni
Good luck! I have to say, I don't think I've ever seen anyone get all of the science points before, so you might be the first.

~Vessel introduction~

Hello fellow kerbonauts!!!

So here's a little update about all the current missions:

As you can see in my space centre I use some abbreviations so I'm
going to explain some of them to you:

The first two letters means the body they are going to, meaning:
- Po = Pol
- Mu = Mun
- Mi = Minmus
- Gi = Gilly
- Ik = Ike
- Ee = Eeloo
- Mo = Moho
- Dr = Dres

All the abbreviations are unique and the science ships are all called <body> explorer.
For the second two letters, they mean a specific purpose, which are:
- OS = Ore Scanner
- Ry = Relay
- MB = Mining Base

There are also some exceptions, such as the Mun Space Station which is called MuSS
or the MM Explorer which means Mun and Minmus explorer. 
And one is called Ike Comnmnet, but I will rename that soon.

Many relays serve more bodies, such as the Ike Relay, Gilly Relay 
and the Pol Mining base. They have to serve the local system. 

The preparation is not clearly finished yet, I still have to make a suitable 
Explorer for the Eve system and for Jool and Laythe. The Tylo Explorer will be renamed 
for exploring Pol, Bop and Vall as well.

 


Enough said!!
Let's look at the ships!

A overview in the tracking station, quite a lot of ships...
 


Of course, first the Kerbal Space Station! Here will all the returning missions dock 
and will the science be gathered in one science container to be returned in once....

 

As you can see, a space shuttle is still docked, it's because Jeb, Bob, Bill and 
Vall just brought a module replacement to the station.

 


The Mun station! 

Nothing spectacular, after the main tank is empty, it will be undocked and then a tanker can be connected.

 

 

This is a mining base (from the the grey tank to the front) and a tanker (the orange part).

The tanker can fly on its own from minmus to Mun to replenish the MM Explorer

 


The Jool system has also a station, for organisation reasons...
 


An example of an explorer, this one has mining capabilities

(I think this is the Duna Explorer, as you can see it's more aerodynamic)
 

I also made a little ship to explore the Kerbol Space
 


Fun pic, you can see how many kerbals are already on a mission... 51!

But I want more! (And that's going to happen for certain)

 

 

Kreetz!

Ferdoni

~Kerbin Explorations~

Hello fellow kerbonauts!!

In the last episodes I gathered most of the science around KSC.
But now is the time for the first real exploration mission!! 

The Kerbal team of this mission is going to be:
Pilot                        - Jedpont Kerman
Flight Engineer       - Caricca Kerman
Commander           - Bilmon Kerman 
Recource engineer - Jengan Kerman

Chief Scientist         - Will Kerman
Scientist                  - Ergee Kerman

Junior Scientist       - Cerdra Kerman

Expected flying time: 5 hours

I will depart just before sunrise at the first light to get the most of the day. 
5 hours of flying time means around 13.000 units of liquid fuel is needed. 
Given the fact that I only have 8000 units, for the refueling point I
will refuel at spots when I have some time left to sunset to get the last bits of sunlight.

Biomes which have to be covered are:
- Ice Caps
- Northern Ice Shelf
- Southern Ice Shelf
- Tundra
- Grasslands
- Deserts
- Badlands
- Atmosphere

The planned route wich is going to be followed is as follows:

 

Because I saw that the wings and ore tanks were empty, I made a small refueling vehicle to pump the last drop of LF and ore in the KBE.

First step, all the way to the south pole! 
I also converted some ore to fuel mid-flight. 
It took me around 1,5 hour real time to fly there, so some homework was made underwhile

 


After the southern ice caps I went to the ice caps! landing was tough, because the 
relief of the terrain. 
flying through the landscape was absolutely astonishing!! look for the pics,
I couldn't imagine the beauty of kerbin until now. I mean, look at this!

Flying to Tundra also was not a punishment at all. 
I discovered when I put down my plane that I had some sunlight left. My ore drills
and converter gave me in around 30 minutes 600LF! Which I found a pretty good deal.
When its dawn again, we're going to pick up the route.


Because flying around Kerbin costs me quite a bit of time, I will cut this exploration in parts.
In the next episode I'm aiming to get at least to the Northern Ice Shelf.


Kreetings!! 

Ferdoni

~Kerbin Explorations - Part 2~

Hello fellow kerbonauts!!

The last episode we flew all the way from the 
KSC via the southern ice caps to the badlands almost on the equator.
Quite the trip i found. In this episode we will complete this exploration run!!!
sort of...
I'm going to explain.

First we actually rode from the badlands to the grasslands.
After the science experiments we went on to the northern ice caps!


And seriously guys, since I started this career, I fell in love with Kerbin, 
I mean, look at this!



Meanwhile in the trip to the Northern Ice Caps I figured that I almost ran out
of fuel!! Quickly put it down in the dark and used a full day to replenish my fuel.
Turned out I hitted the ore jackpot!!

Some pictures of the nightly landing

 


Reaching the Northern Ice Caps

 

Then... I found out that you can do some experiments also while flying over biomes....
well... krap... 
Okay! challenge accepted! 

 

This experiments can be done while flying over the biome:
Crew report
Atmospheric Analysis
Temperature Scan
Eva Report

So I immediately started gathering this experiments. I flew over:
Shores, water, grasslands, highlands, mountains, ice caps, Northern Ice caps and tundra.

I did miss the Badlands and the southern ice caps, so I will cover that later in a mini mission/episode.

At last I landed at the deserts and picked up some fuel from the last daylight

Finally going toward the KSC!

It's in sight!!

 

 

And there she landed, after a 3 day mission, of which 1 day was entirely refueling.
So basically explored Kerbin in 2 days! not bad!

 

And gathered an awful lot of data

 


Question: Should I go also for the flying high biomes? they are likely quite harder to get.
Or should I move on to outside Kerbin?

And I have a request! I tried to get some science from KSC biomes but I didn't
manage to make a suitable VTOL to hover above the Biomes. Has anyone a good
VTOL or stock helicopter?
Thanks in advance!

Greetings!!

Ferdoni

Edited April 20, 2017 by Ferdoni

~Kerbin Explorations - Part 3~

Hello fellow kerbonauts!!

In the last episode we covered, kindof, the rest of the exploration. 
But in this episode we'll doe the rest. We're going to scramble the last science 
with the Kerbin Biome Scrambler!


First fuel tanks away!


Yes... that is Duna!


Second pair of tanks away! And almost above the badlands!

Third pair away! And above the badlands

Just cruisin'... with mach 3
Onwards to the south pole!


Made a stupid mistake here... 
later I returned back from the KSC and did the right experiments above the South Pole

Last tank away! Back to the KSC


Just wow...

There it is!


Cool descent


Touchdown...


...And parked!


Grabbed the science from the a..
(it was seriously the only way i could grab it XD)

Bam!!! 465 science!

And that ends the flying operations above Kerbin!


The second part is about the amount of science I archieved

I gathered 465 data now and the total amount of data is:
Ground     : 10 x 42 (-2)     = 418
Flying L: 4 x 11 + 3    = 47
Flying H: 11 + 6    = 17
Space  L: 2 x 11 + 5    = 27
Space  H: 11 + 6    = 17

Total            = 526
(Normal Biomes = 11, Microbiomes = 31, you cannot do other than ground expirements on micro biomes)

Gathered = 465/526    = 88%

I gathered all the ground and low flying data and none of the high flying date.
That maybe come in the future, as well the space data. But now my data rate is 88% on Kerbin so I call it a succes!

If you want to see a little organization changes that I made to create some more overview,
Open the hidden content

Spoiler

 

I ended the Kerbin Sea Base because it was launched in the beginning of the save
but it didn't had a valid purpose. (Note that all kerbals were recovered safely)

I applied the following changes:
- Ike Commnet         = IkRy
- Jool Space Station     = JSS
- Tylo Explorer        = BPVT Explorer
- Kerbin Ore Scanner    = KeOS


Now everything is ordered in Divisions (small operations) or Squadrons (big operations)

The Kerbol Unit:
- Kerbol Explorer

The Moho Division:
- Moho Explorer
- MoOS-Ry

The Eve Squadron
- GiMB
- GiOS-Ry

The Duna Squadron
- IkOS-Ry
- Ike Explorer
- IkRy (is an extra relay station)
- Duna Explorer

The Kerbin Division
- Kerbin Space Station
- KeOS
- Kerbin Biome Explorer
- Kerbin Biome Scrambler

The MunMinmus Division
- Mun Space Station
- MiOS
- MiMB
- MM Explorer

The Dres Division
- Dres Explorer
- DrOS-Ry

The Jool Squadron
- PoOS-Ry
- PoMB
- Jool Space Station
- BPVT Explorer

The Eeloo Division
- Eeloo Explorer
- EeOS-Ry

The total is 25 vessels/crafts, but it will be more since Jool and Eve need more craft

 


In the next parts I will cover the first Moon operations and the last craft that are to be launched!


Stay tuned!

Hakuna Kerbata!!

Ferdoni

Nice stuff!

I like it! Very ambitious. From here are you planning on collecting the science by returning it to Kerbin, or will you be using transmissions for the trickier-to-reach places (like Eve).

I'm looking forward to seeing your Mun and Minmus biome hoppers. Will you be doing single massive lander, or lots of little baby ones?

When you return to Kerbin later on, will you be doing situational science (splashed grassland) or rare science (splashed mountain)? If so, I finally learned of a place which has the locations of the rare science, The Field Research Pack. It also apparently has a GUI for tracking which experiments have been done in a given biome, which may become handy as your range broadens out beyond Kerbin! I've never used it personally, it's just something I had noticed recently.

Nice "science transfer" at the end there!

I will recover all of it in one time

eve will i explore in a lot of tiny ones. the rest with one craft I you see in the episode "vessel introduction" you see the MM Explorer. he's going to do the job on mun and Minmus. 

because i stated in the topic that i dont want to do repeating experiments, i dont think i would the splashed down expirements. 

the FRP woule come in handy! i will look into it! thanks

~Onwards to Mun!~

Hello everyone!! 

Took me a week to make another episode due to some small holiday stuff

Onwards to Mun! The Mun Space Station and the Mun-Minmus Explorer are both in a eqatorial orbit around Mun.
The MM Explorer is able to explore around 2 or 3 biomes (depending on how far away the landing sites are from each other)

Considering that the Mun has 17 biomes, there is a lot of work to do! But it's done with thanks to Mechjeb

See the content below for a total of Mun science expirements

Spoiler

Expirements        = Landed (9)    = Space low (2)    = Space high (1)
Poles            
Polar Lowlands
Polar Crater
Highlands
Highland Craters
Midlands
Midland Craters    
Lowlands    
Northern Basin    
Farside Basin
Northwest Crater
East Farside Crater    
Canyons    
Farside Crater    
East Crater    
Twin Craters    
Southwest Crater    

Total Biomes          153          34          17

Global Expirements       0          5          6
Total            = 153        = 39        = 23        = 215


I landed on every biome possible, doing the EVA and Gravity scans just above the surface, and the rest while on the surface 


On board I had an scientist to restore the Mystery Goo and the Materials bay.
It gave me 11 data per Biome, considering I had done the 5 space low and 6 biome experiments at this point, i had 71 science (66 + 5)

To get the Space High gravity scans, i launched a small new probe with around 6000 deltaV, the Mun Gravity Scanner or MuGS

Because of his awful lot of deltaV, it could just go everywhere i wanted, not requiring efficient manoeuvring 


The rest of the Biomes did go very well and gave me beautiful shots!

To do the last 3 biomes, poles, polar lowlands and polar crater, I did a burn to give me a polar orbit

Perfect!

I can strongly promote a visit to the Mun's poles! just how beautiful..


On the Mun Space Station there is a science container to easily collect all the data 


And there we are! last science gathered!

Look at this! 193 science data!!!

That means 193/215 = 90% explored!!!!

If you see the total Mun expirements you can see that the total 'landed' and 'space low (including global science)' science data is 192.
This is because I "accidently did a gravity experiment above the Mun's midlands. So the MuGS only has to cover 16 instead of 17 biomes

In the next part we will do the last Mun expirements and go on to Minmus!!
Maybe we will cover the last Kerbin experiments, but only if i have the time

Stay tuned!!

Kreetz

Ferdoni

~From Mun to Minmus with love~

hey everyone!

Okay, so we left Mun 90% explored in the last part.. how about 100% for Mun AND Minmus in this part?

Okay, so I sent my Mun/Minmus Gravity Scanner to get every biome, due to the nuclear propulsion,
I could go everywhere easily
 


Getting every biome...
 


And there you have the gravity data of all 17 biomes!
 


Back again to the Mun Space Station!
 

Wow!! 215 data! all the Mun data
 


Okay! time to go onwards to Minmus! The engine/fuel stage is ditched...
 

...And a fresh new tanker comes in
 


Onwards to Minmus! Both the MuSS and the MM Gravity Scanner are going
 

Departing literally 2 minutes behind each other
 

There it is! The biggest ice cream in the known universe!
 

Decoupling the MM Explorer. Because it has 2200 deltaV, is can do 6 biomes at one time on minmus.
Given that Minmus only has 9 biomes, it didn't took long for me to complete this mission
 


Just some nice shots here for you guys to enjoy

 


And the MM Gravity Scanner just collected all the 9 biomes! 
It has 2000 deltaV left from Mun so it was also done quickly
 


And there we are already docked to the Station! Transferrering sweet science!
 

And here you go! Can you see it?...
 

Ohhh yes you can!!! 334 science!!!!
 


That means 215 + 119 science data... Mun and Minmus 100% explored!!!!!!!!!!

How cool is that? :0 


See content below to see the calculation of Minmus science

Spoiler

Biome:        Landed        Low        High

In the next episode we will look further to Kerbin 
And maybe launch some crafts for Eve, our lovely harsh mistress XD

Stay tuned!

Kreetings,
Ferdoni
